uni.hamburg.yamms.math
Class Topology

java.lang.Object
  uni.hamburg.yamms.math.Topology

public class Topology
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a n-dimensional topology. Topology means a discretized rectangular area in the n-dimensional space. The area is characterized by the edge lengths of its cells, the number of cells in the n dimensions and the origin in terms of cells.

The topology offers a variety of methods for index conversions. There are three types of indezes:

  • linear index with column major order
  • component index: each cell is addressed with a tuple of integers (coordinates). (0,0,0...) represents the origin. negative values are possible
  • position: same as component index, but the tuple is weighted with the edge lengths of the cells

Author:
Claas Abert

the component index

getDistanceTopology

public Topology getDistanceTopology()
Returns a topology containing all possible cell distances as positions. The result is a topology with similar cell sizes whose cell count is doubled in every dimension an is symmetrical in the coordinate origin.

Returns:
the topology

getLinearIdx

public int getLinearIdx(int[] cidx)
converts a component index (a tuple of integers) to a linear index in the context of the topology and with column major order

Parameters:
cidx - the component index
Returns:
the linear index

getMaxIndex

Returns the highest index within the topology in a given direction

Parameters:
i - the direction (dimension)
Returns:
the index

getNeighborStrides

public int[][] getNeighborStrides()
Returns the neighbor configurations for this topology as an array. The first index is the linear index of the cell, the second index addresses the neighbor as described in getNeighborConfiguration.

Returns:
the neighbor strides
